alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 2:58PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Cochise County through 330 PM MST... At 257 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 11 miles east of Willcox, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail and locally heavy rainfall which may lead to minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bowie. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 350 and 353, and between mile markers 357 and 365. Route 186 between mile markers 336 and 352. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox
